member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.Ruler.OnRender(System.Windows.Media.DrawingContext)
member.summary: Participates in rendering operations.
member.param: The drawing instructions for a specific element. This context is provided to the layout system.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.Ruler.MeasureOverride(System.Windows.Size)
member.summary: Measures an instance during the first layout pass prior to arranging it.
member.param: A maximum Size to not exceed.
member.returns: The maximum Size for the instance.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.Ruler.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the length of the ruler. If the property is set to false (default) this is a fixed length. Otherwise the length is calculated based on the actual width of the ruler.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.Ruler.AutoSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the AutoSize behavior of the ruler. false (default): the length of the ruler results from the property. If the window size is changed, e.g. wider than the rulers length, free space is shown at the end of the ruler. No rescaling is done. true : the length of the ruler is always adjusted to its actual width. This ensures that the ruler is shown for the actual width of the window.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.Ruler.Zoom
member.summary: Gets or sets the zoom factor for the ruler. The default value is 1.0.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.Ruler.Chip
member.summary: Sets the location of the chip in the units of the ruler. So, to set the chip to 10 in cm units the chip needs to be set to 10. Use the class for conversions.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.Ruler.CountShift
member.summary: By default the counting of inches or cm starts at zero, this property allows you to shift the counting.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.Ruler.Marks
member.summary: Gets or sets where the marks are shown in the ruler.

member.name: P:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.Ruler.Units
member.summary: Gets or sets the unit of the ruler. Default value is PageUnits.Centimeters.

member.name: T:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper
member.summary: A helper class for DIP (Device Independent Pixels) conversion and scaling operations.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.MmToDip(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts millimeters to DIP (Device Independant Pixels).

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.CmToDip(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts centimeters to DIP (Device Independant Pixels).

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.InchToDip(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts inches to DIP (Device Independant Pixels).

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.PtToDip(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts font points to DIP (Device Independant Pixels).

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.DipToCm(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts DIP (Device Independant Pixels) to centimeters.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.DipToMm(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts DIP (Device Independant Pixels) to millimeters.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.GetSystemDpiFactor
member.summary: Gets the system DPI scale factor (compared to 96 dpi). From http://blogs.msdn.com/jaimer/archive/2007/03/07/getting-system-dpi-in-wpf-app.aspx Should not be called before the Loaded event (else XamlException mat throw)
member.returns: A System.Windows.Point object containing the X- and Y- scale factor.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.GetSystemDpi
member.summary: Gets the system configured DPI.
member.returns: A System.Windows.Point object containing the X- and Y- DPI.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.GetPhysicalDpi(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the physical pixel density (DPI) of the screen.
member.param: Size - in inch - of the diagonal of the screen.
member.returns: A System.Windows.Point object containing the X- and Y- DPI.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.DpiToScaleFactor(System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Converts a DPI into a scale factor (compared to system DPI).
member.param: A System.Windows.Point object containing the X- and Y- DPI to convert.
member.returns: A System.Windows.Point object containing the X- and Y- scale factor.

member.name: M:ArcGIS.Desktop.Layouts.DipHelper.GetScreenIndependentScaleFactor(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the scale factor to apply to a WPF application so that 96 DIP always equals 1 inch on the screen (whatever the system DPI).
member.param: Size - in inch - of the diagonal of the screen
member.returns: A System.Windows.Point object containing the X- and Y- scale factor.
